name: wwi-start
description: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand sparked the Great War.

name: wwi-end
description: The armistice was signed ending the Great War after four years of conflict.

name: wwii-start
description: Germany invaded Poland, triggering the Second World War.

name: wwii-end
description: Japan surrendered following the atomic bombings, ending WWII.

name: pearl-harbor
description: Japan's surprise attack on Pearl Harbor brought the US into WWII.

name: d-day
description: Allied forces invaded Normandy in the largest amphibious assault in history.

name: hiroshima
description: The first nuclear weapon used in warfare devastated Hiroshima.

name: waterloo
description: Napoleon's final defeat ended French dominance in Europe.

name: civil-war-start
description: The Confederate attack on Fort Sumter started the American Civil War.

name: vietnam-end
description: The Fall of Saigon marked the end of the Vietnam War.

name: first-crusade
description: Pope Urban II called for the first military expedition to the Holy Land.

name: norman-conquest
description: William the Conqueror defeated King Harold at the Battle of Hastings.

name: alexander-empire
description: Alexander the Great defeated the Persian Empire at Gaugamela.

name: rome-falls
description: The last Roman emperor was deposed, ending ancient Rome.

name: constantinople-falls
description: The Ottoman conquest ended the Byzantine Empire after 1000 years.

name: genghis-khan
description: Genghis Khan united the Mongol tribes and began building an empire.

name: september-11
description: Terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center and Pentagon killed nearly 3,000.

name: cuban-missile
description: A 13-day confrontation brought the US and USSR to the brink of nuclear war.

name: gunpowder-europe
description: The introduction of gunpowder weapons revolutionized European warfare.
